description.narrative: By 2020, education stakeholders, especially in the Sahel and East regions, are better equipped to support improved access to quality education for girls and boys aged 3-16 years, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, education stakeholders, especially in the Sahel and East regions, are better equipped to support improved access to quality education for girls and boys aged 3-16 years, including in emergency situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to improve the quality of education through training of teachers and community members, provision of school materials and curriculum reform. The number of QCFS supported by UNICEF has increased from 1,291 to 1,648 between 2018-2019. UNICEF's supports to MoE focused on curriculum reform and capacity development of teachers. UNICEF also integrated strategies that are relevant to the current security context in different training modules including the curriculum of the Teachers' training schools, including QCFS, ZRPAC, the Safe School approaches and conflict resolution. A total of 34,921 children in emergency-affected zones have received learning materials from UNICEF. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Children provided with individual (one-per-child) education/early learning materials through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
% of pupils benefiting from the new rapid reading approach who reach the minimum proficiency in reading in pilot schools
Service Delivery - Schools that received support from UNICEF through the child-friendly school or similar model
